snippet: The approval in Rhode Island followed a 16-year struggle in the heavily Roman Catholic state, with intense opposition from clerics and many Republicans.
abstract: Rhode Island becomes nation's 10th state, and last in New England, to approve same-sex marriage.

byline.contributor: Jen McCaffery contributed reporting from Providence, R.I.

lead_paragraph: The approval in Rhode Island followed a 16-year struggle in the heavily Roman Catholic state, with intense opposition from clerics and many Republicans.

headline.seo: Rhode Island Joins States That Allow Gay Marriage
headline.main: Rhode Island Joins States That Allow Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Rhode Island Joins States That Allow Gay Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
